title: 111_s3645
content: SECTION 1. DEFINITIONS AND FINDINGS. In this Act, a "classified school employee" refers to an employee in various occupational specialties from pre-kindergarten through higher education. The Act also defines other terms according to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The Congress recognizes the valuable services provided by classified school employees in areas such as transportation, facilities maintenance, food service, safety, and health care. They play a vital role in ensuring the welfare and safety of students and strive for excellence in all aspects of service to the education community. Exemplary classified school employees should be acknowledged for their outstanding contributions to quality education in the United States. A recognition program is established to acknowledge exemplary classified school employees for their outstanding contributions to education in the United States. The Secretary of Education will establish the "National Classified School Employees of the Year Awards" program to recognize employees in various occupational specialties who provide exemplary service to students in public schools. Occupational specialties include paraprofessionals, clerical and administrative services, transportation services, food and nutrition services, custodial and maintenance services, security services, and health and student services. The Secretary of Education will establish the "National Classified School Employees of the Year Awards" program to recognize employees in various occupational specialties who provide exemplary service to students in public schools. Prior to March 31 of each year, an employee from each occupational specialty will be selected to receive an award under the recognition program. The Secretary will solicit nominations from each occupational specialty by November 1 of each year. The program "National Classified School Employees of the Year Awards" recognizes employees in different occupational specialties based on nominations from local educational agencies, school administrators, professional associations, labor unions, and other groups determined appropriate by the Secretary. Each State's chief school officer must submit nominations for individuals to receive recognition under this program. The program "National Classified School Employees of the Year Awards" requires nominations to be submitted to the Secretary demonstrating excellence in work performance, school and community involvement, leadership, local support, and image enhancement. The Secretary will develop guidelines for selecting deserving nominees. The Secretary will develop guidelines for selecting deserving nominees based on demonstrations in specified areas.
